Class AddPartController

java.lang.Object
controller_controllerfiles.AddPartController
public class AddPartController extends Object
The controller class for the add part screen of the project.

    • getvariableBottomFieldLabel

      public void getvariableBottomFieldLabel(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is for changing the bottom label depending on which radio button is selected.
      Parameters:
      event - Radio buttons to determine a text label.

    • partMinValidation

      private boolean partMinValidation(int min, int max)
      This method validates minimum text field on add part page. Checks if partMin is less than or equal to 0 or if partMin is greater than or equal to partMax.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum value for the part.
      max - The maximum value for the part.
      Returns:
      Returns boolean indicating if min is valid.

    • partMaxValidation

      private boolean partMaxValidation(int min, int max, int stock)
      This method validates maximum and inventory text fields on add part page. Checks if partStock is greater than partMax or less than partMin.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum value for the part.
      max - The maximum value for the part.
      stock - The stock value for the part.
      Returns:
      Returns boolean indicating if inventory is valid.

    • onCancelAddPartScreen

      void onCancelAddPartScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method changes the scene back to the main screen scene when the cancel button is pressed.
      Parameters:
      event - Cancel button action on the add part screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - From FXMLLoader.

    • saveAddPartAction

      void saveAddPartAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method saves text entered to a new part and changes back to main scene - RUNTIME ERROR HERE.

      RUNTIME ERROR: Caused by: java.lang.NumberFormatException. This error was corrected by adding try catch blocks to catch and handle errors caused by invalid data being entered into the text fields. The catch statement pull various error messages from the switch block "alertsAddPartOptions" to let the user know what needs to be corrected.

      Creates a new part by getting the text entered into the text fields. Generates various error messages to ensure data is valid. Returns to the main scene if partAddSuccessful returns true.
      Parameters:
      event - Save button action on add part page.
      Throws:
      IOException - From FXMLLoader.

    • alertsAddPartOptions

      private void alertsAddPartOptions(int alertsAddPart)
      This method provides alerts and error messages. A switch statement with cases is used to contain alerts that can be called by numbers 1-5.
      Parameters:
      alertsAddPart - Alert message options.
